As the advertising and media landscape continues to globalize, our STALKR team is looking to add a team member who is fluent in Chinese and/or Korean. If you are interested in media production and are fluent in either Chinese or Korean languages, please consider applying to our Visual Researcher position. 



STALKR is the world leader in creative footage sourcing, licensing and clearing existing content for commercials, movies and more. We primarily work with advertising agencies, editorial houses and production companies to make their visions come true. We are currently looking to add a remote visual researcher to our growing team. 



The role of the Visual Researcher consists of searching for, visually filtering, and delivering video content consistent with creative briefs on commercial projects. This may include scrolling through digital libraries, vimeo, youtube, social media and beyond. We are specifically looking for tenacious, thorough, insatiably curious, and creative individuals with a general passion for and knowledge of visual media, creative researching, artistic interpretation, and resourceful problem solving. 



The Visual Researcher often doubles as a clearance manager and assists the Producer in determining licensing release status, as well as tracking down and gaining talent and property releases. We are looking for candidates with excellent interpersonal skills who have the ability to multi-task and manage time responsibly across multiple concurrent projects, all while communicating cohesively within team environments.



Requirements:

For this particular position, fluency in either Chinese or Korean is highly recommended 
Must have at least two years of experience working in a creative field of a visual nature: TV, Film, Commercials, Video Production, Advertising, or other similarly imaginative field
Must possess strong organizational and communication skills
Must be comfortable in an online environment. Members of your team may be spread across the country - willingness to work different time zones is hugely beneficial!
Computer/Web fluency: typing, browsing, search engines, spreadsheet and social media familiarity, technical proficiency and problem solving 
Knowledge of Google Docs, Google Sheets, Basecamp, Wiredrive and Final Cut Pro
Sports familiarity, Fluency in multiple languages and Research experience a plus


The Details:

Training period is Monday- Friday, 9am - 5:30pm. If you are outside of the PDT timezone, please keep in mind that your first 2 weeks of training may be from 9 am - 5:30 pm PDT
Following training, Researchers are booked on an “as needed” project basis
Must be flexible with scheduling as bookings will vary based on project needs
Must be available to work Monday - Friday, 9 - 5:30pm in your timezone. Willingness to work different timezones is a huge plus!
Must be willing to work occasional late nights and weekends


The Perks:

$20/hr to start

Market Researcher", "source": "craigslist.com", "company_name": null, "detail_url": "https://sfbay.craigslist.org/pen/mar/d/menlo-park-health-it-market-researcher/7310970446.html", "location": "SF bay area / Menlo Park", "country": "United States", "state": "California", "city": "SF bay area", "description": "QR Code Link to This Post


Sujansky & Associates, LLC (www.sujansky.com) is seeking a part-time researcher to collect market data for specific technologies.  The project would begin in mid-May, last approximately one month, and be do-able remotely.  

The project will entail researching clinical decision support, population health, consumer engagement, and other healthcare applications that require access to data from patients’ EHR records.  Such 3rd-party applications, distinct from and auxiliary to EHRs themselves, are rapidly proliferating given recent advancements in standardized APIs and federal regulations that mandate the electronic sharing of clinical data with patients.  The goal of the researcher's work will be to identify and characterize such applications, whether developed in research environments or commercial settings, and to identify the relevant developers for each application who can be contacted to collect additional data during a subsequent phase of the project.  The result of the project will be a structured directory of such applications.

Desired qualifications include some understanding of the health care system, general familiarity with techniques for health data interoperability, resourcefulness, dogged perseverance, and attention to detail.  No specific technical skills are required, other than facility with spreadsheet and desktop database software.

College graduates and suitably qualified college students may apply.

The position will pay $65/hour and the project will require approximately 100 hours of work.  

Thank you."}, {"date_posted": "2021-04-22T11:34:00", "title": "Health I.T. Hagen/Sinclair Research Recruiting Inc."}, {"date_posted": "2021-04-21T10:53:00", "title": "Writer for Cannabis Consultancy", "source": "craigslist.com", "company_name": null, "detail_url": "https://sfbay.craigslist.org/nby/wri/d/sebastopol-writer-for-cannabis/7310436291.html", "location": "SF bay area / Sebastopol", "country": "United States", "state": "California", "city": "SF bay area", "description": "QR Code Link to This Post


POSITION: Copy Writer
COMPANY: 421 Group, a California consultancy that offers strategic public affairs and operational support services to help cannabis businesses navigate the legal market.
STATUS: Hourly, non-exempt. 32-40 hours per week 
COMPENSATION: $24-$29/hr, DOE. Eligible after a probationary period for 50% company-paid health benefits for employee and dependents, plus annual accrual of up to two weeks vacation and 6 sick days.
GENERAL SUMMARY OF DUTIES: The Researcher & Technical Writer’s main job function is to draft, refine, and finalize documents for public, private, and professional use. They also act as a research lead for 421 Group and our affiliates, gathering and organizing information both for reports and informed internal decision making. Additionally, as with all team roles, this person is an important administrator and representative to our Clients and to the community as a whole.
SUPERVISION RECEIVED: Reports to and receives primary direction from the Client Services Manager, with additional direction from the Executive Team.
SUPERVISION EXERCISED: None. 
EXAMPLES OF DUTIES
Writing


Take the primary role in writing and refining a broad spectrum of document types, including


Project narratives for conditional use permit applications


Status reports


Community Benefits reports


Opportunity assessments and feasibility reports


Survey analyses


Press releases


Talking points for business owners and community leaders


Promotional materials


Bios and public-facing profiles


Employee communications


Public newsletters


Investor reports




Identify optimal positioning and context for public affairs content to support 421 Group and Client goals in the context of dynamic, real-time influences and events.


Track and assemble large-scale, collaborative documents such as applications and major reports.


Organize material and complete writing assignments according to set standards regarding order, clarity, conciseness, style, and terminology.


Edit, standardize, and incorporate material prepared by others.


Prepare documents for print and web layout, including selection of images, infographics, and brand elements. 


Coordinate design, duplication, and distribution of materials.


Review published materials and recommend revisions or changes in scope, format, content, and methods of reproduction and binding as needed.


Communicate and collaborate directly with Clients and public officials on writing assignments.


Recommend changes and general improvements to Style Guide as well as methods of creative collaboration.


Research


Prepare weekly Jurisdiction Report outlining relevant Planning Commission, Council, Board, and other meetings of governmental agencies.


Collect and organize data pertaining to private and public endeavors through surveys, internet research, and interviews.


Develop and maintain spreadsheets for a variety of uses, utilizing formulas and statistical analysis methods to clearly and efficiently convey data.


Researching market conditions and competitive activities, political climate in new jurisdictions, conducting property and location searches, and extracting regulatory details and prepared reports.


Interview appropriate outside personnel, read journals and other material to become familiar with relevant local and state regulations, product technologies and production methods, follow industry trends, and to refine copy-writing.


Administration


Communicate with Clients and other stakeholders in a professional and effective manner.


Maintain orderly records and workflow documents in Google Drive, including files that are highly confidential in nature. 


Contribute to and observe a team calendar that will be utilized daily by teammates, Clients, and contractors. 


Establish and maintain cooperative relationships with representatives of community, consumer, employee, and public interest groups.


Support Clients in meetings to review their projects; tracking goals, actions, ideas, questions, decisions, and deliverables. 


Convey assignments to team members and follow up on deadlines.


Perform other duties as assigned. 


PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS
Communication: Excellent command of English, spoken and written. Ability to proofread, draft new correspondence and procedural writing from scratch; adapt language to various speakers, styles, settings, and tone. Get to know several teams and their interdependencies, quickly understand relationships and appropriate interaction for each group/individual. 
Professional Demeanor: Take on work in a collegial, collaborative, open, and friendly way. Ability to establish rapport and form great relationships with internal and external team members across multiple organizations and communities.Arrives on time, ready to work, every day. Communicates frequently and clearly. Meets deadlines or informs in advance of delays. Performs consistently well. Strive for extraordinary accuracy in correspondence, data management; paying careful attention to detail from initial planning to execution and follow-up. Positive energy and creative thinking. Easy going, confident, comfortable. Approaches problem-solving with an open mind, not with drama. Be willing to learn new skills. 
Workflow Management: Be functionally organized, toggling comfortably between digital and physical file systems. Recognize what’s most important to tackle, in what order, and be prepared to make informed, independent decisions. Able to take direction from multiple sources. Able to anticipate what should happen next, and be proactive in planning for it. What might someone need? What’s the contingency plan? Are there additional steps that can be taken to ensure completion of the greater objective? This role requires a tenacious spirit and a self-starting attitude. Able to see the whole system, understand the complexity of a situation and the magnitude of the inter-dependencies. Use good judgment in escalating issues.
Confidentiality: Maintain strictest confidentiality at all times - avoiding direct and indirect disclosure. Discretion is key due to exposure to financial data and executive-level conversations. 
TECHNOLOGY & OTHER REQUIREMENTS


Computer & Devices: Highly functional on modern computers, smart phones, and other connected devices.


Typing: 60 WPM or faster, accurately.


Google Apps: “Power User” of Google Apps, including Drive, Docs, Sheets, Slides, and security and sharing knowledge. Able to manage multiple Google Apps email accounts.


Spreadsheets & Databases: High level of proficiency using spreadsheets for both data management and process management, exhibiting comfort and efficiency in building from scratch and elaborating to perfection.


Project Management Software: Comfortable communicating on projects using all manner of tools available. 


Adobe Acrobat: Able to edit PDFs, combine PDFs, print as PDF, troubleshoot quality issues.


Smart phone: Must be smart-phone fluent. 


Internet Research: Must be an internet-research expert, savvy at finding all manner of information efficiently and able to validate the reliability of the source. 


Culture match: Support the mission and spirit of the organization. 


Utility Access: Must have a fast and reliable internet and phone connection from your home or office. We work remote, and plan to for the foreseeable future.


EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE


Four-year degree preferred.


4 years of relevant experience required.


Must be at least 21 years old, and pass a criminal background check.


TYPICAL PHYSICAL DEMANDS


Work may require prolonged standing, sitting, some bending, stooping, and stretching.


Requires eye-hand coordination and manual dexterity sufficient to operate a computer, telephone, calculator, and other office equipment.


Requires normal range of hearing.


Requires close vision, with the ability to see color and adjust focus.


TYPICAL WORKING CONDITIONS


Work is conducted remotely for the foreseeable future. A company issued laptop is provided. Cell phone and home internet stipends are provided, as well as any materials and supplies required to conduct work. You must have access to reliable internet and cell phone service during normal business hours. This stipend shall cease should we determine the need to create a centralized work-office environment.


Some in-person meetings may occur in private and public settings. All Covid safety protocols will be followed and enforced.


Work is high energy and fast-paced, and, due to the nature of the work and the regulatory landscape, is often either very exciting or highly stressful, depending on one's perspective.


Position requires regular availability to be scheduled for work during normal office hours which are Monday through Friday from 8:30am to 5pm, plus occasional nights, weekends, holidays, and/or events. Shifts of 6 hours or more will include a 30-60 minute unpaid meal break and duty free ten minute breaks per labor law recommendations. 


May require some travel.


421 Group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer."}, {"date_posted": "2021-04-14T16:22:00", "title": "1 Full 2 Part/ paid/unpaid Volunteer for office asst, Writing/Research", "source": "craigslist.com", "company_name": null, "detail_url": "https://sfbay.craigslist.org/eby/wri/d/berkeley-full-part-paid-unpaid/7306960839.html", "location": "SF bay area / Berkeley", "country": "United States", "state": "California", "city": "SF bay area", "description": "QR Code Link to This Post


Hello,

We are the International Institute of Bengal and Himalayan Basins (IIBHB), which focuses on water preservation and groundwater depletion in vulnerable areas across the globe. We have small  (office) action centers in England, India, and Bangladesh in addition to our main headquarters in Berkeley, California. We need a grant writer, editor  and computer  researcher, experience is an asset not required.

We are seeking paid or unpaid volunteers to assist in our work, which revolves around conducting research and assisting in writing articles/papers on topics surrounding climate change and water resources in collaboration with international coworkers. There are many opportunities for growth including for those with existing non-profit or research experience or those seeking to begin their careers without such. We have additional need for those with technical and IT skills especially related to website design. Experience is not required. 

We also provide opportunities for housing include parking in South Berkeley that may be worked into your compensation  (worth $1100 to $1500 dollars/month on negotiation. For full time intern  position an additional monthly stipend and for part time position only Stipend  will be provided.

Singer Associates Public Relations: One of California’s leading public relations and public affairs firms is seeking Junior AEs and Account Executives in San Francisco. 

Account Executives work across client accounts and are experienced researchers, editors, writers, and pitchers, along with being skilled and agile project managers. They are experienced enough to step up on accounts, teach teammates basic PR skills, and drive initiatives in areas where their talents stand out. 

Essential Responsibilities/Duties:

•	Possess excellent writing and editing skills. Ability to contact media and write marketing materials, including press releases, pitches, source sheets, social media publishing calendars, program reports, and memos
•	Demonstrate excellent judgment and problem-solving abilities. 
•	Able to develop public relations, marketing, and social media strategies with guidance and coordinate team efforts to implement them
•	Manage projects using organizational skills, working with colleagues, vendors, and others while keeping project leaders apprised of status. Must be detail-oriented without losing sight of the big picture and be able to multi-task
•	Understand key client information, including business strategy, industry issues, products and services, key customers, and competitors. Provide client service and administrative support. Attend meetings. Handle scheduling logistics. And draft agendas and recaps

•	2-4 years of communications, PR, or transferable work experience, preferably at an agency

•	Strong research, writing, editing, and content generation skills across mediums. Ability to develop media contacts/relationships 
•	Impeccable client management, customer service, interpersonal, and communication skills 
•	Ability to work concurrently across multiple, diverse clients. Skilled at prioritizing workload and deliverables to meet client and team deadlines in a fast-paced environment 
•	Solutions-oriented, proactive attitude, excellent organizational skills, consistent follow-through, and an eye for details
•	Ability to work independently and multi-task in a team-oriented environment 
•	A sense of humor, desire to learn, and the ability to stay calm under pressure 
•	BA/BS in Communications, Marketing, Public Affairs or related course of study

UCSF Pediatric Hemorrhagic Stroke Postdoctoral Research Fellowship

Opportunity:  The Center of Excellence in Pediatric Hemorrhagic Stroke Research at UCSF Benioff Children’s Hospital is seeking applicants for a two-year funded postdoctoral research fellowship.  Fellow 1 (of three funded fellowship positions) will participate in one of the Center’s three projects:

1.	“Predictors of Growth, Recurrence, and High-risk Features in Pediatric Brain Arteriovenous Malformation 
          (bAVM).”  Project 1 will investigate advanced imaging features and molecular factors associated with 
          bAVM dynamic changes and hemorrhage.  
2.	“Predicting Outcomes in Pediatric Hemorrhagic Stroke with Personalized Connectomics.”  Project 2 will 
          assess the utility of advanced structural and functional imaging to predict outcomes.
3.	“Epidemiology of Pediatric Hemorrhagic Stroke and bAVMs in a Multicenter International Cohort.”   
          Project 3 seeks to expand knowledge of pediatric HS and bAVM at a population level with an emphasis on 
          understanding barriers to care in resource-limited settings 

Desired experience:   imaging post-processing and analysis, computational bioinformatics, and/or experience working with large-scale sequencing or expression datasets (Projects 1 & 2), or clinical research experience (Project 3). The Fellow will have the opportunity to interact and work closely with multiple teams involved in clinical, imaging, sequencing, and plasma biomarker analyses.  https://pediatricstroke.ucsf.edu/hemorrhagic-stroke-center-exellence 

The selected fellows will develop Individual Development Plans (IDP) under the guidance of the Center Training Director.   The fellows will also benefit from the broader ASA/Bugher Foundation Network of Centers of Excellence in Hemorrhagic Stroke Research.  This includes annual Network retreats, opportunities to visit other Centers for training experiences, and a curriculum specifically designed for Hemorrhagic Stroke postdoctoral fellows by the Network Training Center.   More information about the network is on the AHA/ASA website:  https://newsroom.heart.org/news/11-12m-gift-supporting-hemorrhagic-stroke-treatment-launches-innovative-research-network 

Center Training Director:  Heather J. Fullerton, MD, MAS, Chief of the UCSF Division of Child Neurology; vascular neurologist and NIH-funded pediatric stroke investigator 

Project PIs:  Helen Kim, PhD, Director, UCSF Center for Cerebrovascular Research, genetic epidemiologist; Jarod Roland, MD, pediatric neurosurgeon and imaging researcher; Christine Fox, MD, MAS, Director, UCSF Pediatric Stroke & Cerebrovascular Disease Center; Noma Dlamini, MD, PhD, Scientific Director, International Pediatric Stroke Study

Duration:  2-years 

Fellow 1:  July 1, 2021 through June 30, 2023
Fellow 2:  July 1, 2022 through June 30, 2024
Fellow 3:   July 1, 2023 through June 30, 2025

Eligibility criteria:

•	Doctorate degree (MD, PhD, or equivalent)
•	US citizen, permanent resident, or visa holder (E-3, H1-B, O-1, TN, J-1, F-1, or G-4; in place by the start 
        date)
•	May not hold another comparable fellowship award
•	May not hold a faculty or staff appointment, with the exception of MDs or MD/PhDs with clinical 
        responsibilities (may hold a title of instructor for the purpose of clinical duties)

Diversity Statement:  Our Center is committed to promoting diversity, broadly defined as including, but not limited to, gender, race, ethnicity, disability, and sexual orientation.  

How to Apply:  Applicants should send their CV with a letter of interest (LOI) to Dr. Fullerton, Heather.Fullerton@ucsf.edu . About the Organization

ClimateWorks Foundation is a global organization committed to our mission: to end the climate crisis by amplifying the power of philanthropy. Since our founding in 2008, we have awarded over $1 billion in grants to more than 500 organizations advancing climate solutions around the world. We helped grow the field of climate philanthropy to where it stands today, establishing infrastructure, global networks, and momentum for continued growth. Through our Global Programs and Services, we equip philanthropy with global knowledge, networks, and solutions to drive climate progress.

•	Scaling solutions: Our collaborative Global Programs — focused on solution areas including carbon dioxide removal, cooling, industry, transportation, and more — produce results that are bending the greenhouse gas emissions curve. From the U.S. to Europe, China, Brazil, and beyond, we collaborate with a diverse community of funders, NGOs, and climate leaders to accelerate just and equitable climate solutions.

•	Guiding and supporting funders: Our Global Services provide funders with comprehensive resources to assess, build, evolve, and execute high-impact climate-giving strategies. Our Global Intelligence service equips funders and the climate community with climate insights to pinpoint opportunities for impact and philanthropic insights to help identify investment priorities. We facilitate Global Collaborations that enable funders to increase individual and collective impact. Our Global Grantmaking services enable funders to invest in climate solutions around the world. 

•	Fostering collaboration, exploration, and growth: Our collaborative approach and commitment to learning ensures that we continuously explore innovative ideas and emerging opportunities — all with the aim of scaling philanthropy-supported initiatives to help end the climate crisis.

As experts in climate science, public policy, economic and social analysis, and strategic philanthropy, ClimateWorks’ staff understands the multi-faceted challenges and opportunities of climate change. We are researchers, strategists, collaborators, and grantmakers who care passionately about our mission. For more information, please visit https://www.climateworks.org. 

About our Team
Climate change is one of the defining issues of our time – impacting our health, our safety, and our livelihoods now and for generations to come. Despite growing awareness and increased public mobilization on this issue, we are not yet on track to contain this threat. But we can be. Humanity has the solutions and the pathways to end this crisis, and collectively we can make this decade the one for climate action. 

Sound compelling? We think so too. The communications and marketing team at ClimateWorks Foundation plays a key role in building awareness, generating donor interest, and promoting philanthropic collaborations that can help end the climate crisis. We’re a quickly growing team, working to expand the organization’s impact, outreach, and engagement to donors, partners, and grantees globally. 

About the Job

If you’re seeking a position where the work you do makes a difference in the world and where you can put your fingerprints on the development of something new, this job could be for you. We’re looking for an experienced manager of donor communications who can apply their strategic thinking and creativity to help build this new function at ClimateWorks. Working with our development team, you’ll help map out the development process and identify and develop materials, events, and outreach campaigns to engage and build our donor community.  

This is a highly collaborative role where you’ll also partner with our programs and services teams, external partners and vendors, and your teammates in our communications team to deliver on projects. Your superb ability to tell a story in words, slides, or video will come in handy as you communicate the extraordinary impact that philanthropy can have on climate change mitigation and the benefits to donors of working with ClimateWorks.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities 

•	Collaborate with the development team to create a communications strategy and materials to achieve annual fundraising goals.
•	Support the development process for new climate donors by assisting with proposal development and presentations.
•	Identify and develop succinct and compelling materials to support ClimateWorks-wide and program/service-specific fundraising, including case statements, concept notes, pitch decks, etc.
•	Partner with the development team to create targeted outreach to build donor engagement, from first contact through stewardship, across channels – email, web, events, etc.
•	Interview donors to create stories of impact that highlight the value of the ClimateWorks platform and publish as articles, blogs, videos, etc. 
•	Be a liaison between the development team and the communications and marketing team. 
•	Work with in-house communications and external vendors to produce materials and execute communications plans.
•	Develop & publish the ClimateWorks annual report.

Required Qualifications 

•	7-9 years of experience leading donor communications strategies at an organization focused on climate, environment, social justice, or research
•	Deep understanding of the development process for cultivating and stewarding major donors – ideally foundations, family offices, and high net worth individuals
•	Superb writing and editing skills with proven ability to translate complex concepts into crisp, clear, accessible language, especially suitable for donor communications
•	Strong storytelling ability – communicated via words, presentations, proposals, video, and more
•	Demonstrated understanding of current trends in fundraising and communications
•	Strong project management skills, attention to detail, and ability to set priorities and complete projects in a timely manner
•	Enthusiastic and natural team player with strong communications skills and the ability to work with cross-functional, virtual, and diverse teams to develop plans and drive results
•	Proficiency working with PowerPoint, Excel, and InDesign
•	A commitment to a diverse, inclusive, and equitable work environment

Preferred Qualifications

•	Bachelor’s degree in communications, journalism, or related field (or equivalent relevant experience) 
•	Significant knowledge and interest in climate change, climate policy, and other relevant fields 
•	Passionate about working to end the climate crisis and create a safe, equitable, and sustainable future
•	Experience working in an organization that is quickly scaling
•	Familiarity working with marketing systems such as Word Press, Salesforce, Pardot, and Google Analytics

Location 

ClimateWorks Foundation is based in the San Francisco Financial District. In light of COVID-19, we expect for this position to commence initially as a remote work opportunity as state and local health guidelines evolve.

To Apply 

ClimateWorks Foundation is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes a diverse candidate pool. The Foundation recognizes diversity as an asset essential to accomplishing its work and views diversity as encompassing differences in race and gender/gender identity, as well as age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, job skills, education, and geographic location. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply as soon as possible.

To be considered for this position, interested candidates must follow the link below to submit a resume and cover letter. This position will remain open until filled.

PAY FOR SUCCESS, REMOTE, PART-TIME CONTRACT OPPORTUNITY

About RWS
RWS is the world leader in intellectual property (IP) search services. With the AOP Connect™ platform and our global community of researchers, RWS has revolutionized the way patents are searched by uniquely leveraging a crowdsourcing model.  RWS broadcasts its studies to the world’s largest patent research community, over 42,000 highly-educated and qualified researchers, distributing millions in rewards to researchers for their work.  RWS specializes in identifying non-textual and non-patent literature, finding prior art references and Evidence of Use that others simply do not have the resources to find. RWS is a partner to 17 Fortune 100 companies, 74 Forbes Global 2000 and 7 of the top 10 US patent filers.

In the past few months, we've seen a great response from clients bringing in more studies, resulting in a total current pool of $64,000 USD available for open studies.  Click here to see the complete list of open studies: https://app.articleonepartners.com/ip-research/studies/active.  It's worth mentioning that we will likely surpass $10,000,000 USD in total rewards paid some time during this calendar year and we’ve paid more than $300,000 USD in rewards in the last 12 months. We're expecting this growth to continue, which means more studies, more technologies, and more earnings opportunities for you! 

Our community is a diverse global group of students, professionals, freelance technology experts and other individuals who are generally interested in research and technology. Your unique background and experience will allow you to be a vital member of the RWS community. 

Opportunity 
RWS is seeking Technical Literature Researchers to support our growing inventory of technical and research studies. 
•	Pay for Success – the best researchers get rewarded based on the quality of their research. Earn compensation for finding key technical literature related to selected patents and technology areas. 
•	Work at your convenience. Choose your projects, and conduct your research at your own time. 
•	Use your expertise, and explore new technology areas. Join a global community of researchers who enjoy the challenge and reward of using their investigatory and analytical skills to increase patent quality and resolve litigation activities. 
•	Specifically, if your background is in Physics, Imaging, Computer Engineering, Electronics, Telecommunications, Cybersecurity, Information Services, Software Engineering, Machinery, Mechanical Engineering, Robotics, Technology and/or Industrial & Product Design, we’ve got some public studies available right now!

What is Technical Literature Research? 
Technical literature research involves searching for and analyzing documents that provide information related to a particular subject area, technology, product, etc. Technical literature includes everything from issued patents to white papers to product manuals and can come from all parts of the world; we may even request physical products themselves.  Your goal as a Technical Literature Researcher is to use industry / market knowledge, literature and technical information, web searching capabilities, and/or technical experience to help uncover literature that is related to a specific Study that is posted on RWS’s AOP Connect™ platform. 

Who Should Register? 
We encourage anyone who has an interest in technical literature research, or even the hunt of simply “finding things”, to join our community. This opportunity is a perfect fit for: 
• Those looking to leverage their education and/or work experience to earn additional money; 
• Those interested in putting their technical or research skills to use on their own schedule; 
• Those with a high level of intellectual curiosity and a desire to solve technical challenges; 

Beneficial Skills 
•	Strong research skills (Boolean searching, advanced Google searchers, access to technical information)
•	Strong attention to detail 
•	Analytical mindset with excellent problem-solving skills 
•	Ability to prioritize and follow a detailed list of search requirements 
•	High level of initiative 
•	Receptive to feedback and guidance from study organizers 
•	Tenacious and determined; you will be contributing alongside many talented researchers 

Still unsure as to how to find Technical Literature? Don't worry, we will provide access to training which will help establish key Researcher skills and get you started with this exciting opportunity. 

What Now?  You must register to participate.  To register as a Researcher, CLICK THIS LINK OR PASTE DIRECTLY INTO YOUR BROWSER:  https://www.rws.com/what-we-do/rws-ip-services/ip-research/become-a-researcher/
